title: How to Apply for a Replacement of Resident ID Card
content_markdown:
#  How to Apply for a Replacement of Resident ID Card 

Modified on: Mon, 26 May, 2025 at 11:12 AM

The resident ID is a form of local identification issued to foreigners living in Rwanda. The reasons for replacement include: lost, stolen, damaged, or correction. This application requires the applicant to be 16 years old and above, have a passport, and have a Rwandan permit for longer than 6 months. If you haven't applied for a resident ID, apply for a new ID. The service is provided by the Directorate General of Immigration and Emigration (DGIE) office. 

  

The processing time is 5 days, and the price depends on the reason for replacement.

  

Prerequisites: 

  * Applicants must be 16 years old and above.

  * Applicants can apply for this service with or without an Irembo account.

  * Applicants should have any travel document, such as a valid passport or laissez-passer, etc.

  * Applicants should have valid permits.

  * Applicants should have a passport and Rwandan permit valid for longer than 6 months.

  * The applicant should have an existing resident ID card number.

  * Applicants should have a valid phone number, email address, or both. 

  

Follow these simple steps to replace the resident ID card: 

  1. Visit [www.irembo.gov.rw](<http://www.irembo.gov.rw>) and under Immigration and Emigration, click on Resident ID Card. 

  2. Select “Replacement of resident ID card” and click on Apply. 

  3. Fill in the applicant details, travel document number, existing resident ID card, and place of collection, then click on Next to proceed. 

  4. Verify that the information is true, enter a phone number and/or email address, check the verification box, and click on Submit.

  5. A billing number/ID (88….) will be generated for payment click pay.

  6. Applicants choose the mode of payment. For more information about payment modes, click [here](<https://support.irembo.gov.rw/en/support/solutions/articles/47001146862-how-to-pay-for-a-service>).

NOTE: After applying and paying successfully via IremboGov, the applicant receives a feedback notification from the DGIE informing them to visit their office for further instructions about their application.
